# Canadian Hydrographic Service - Arctic Survey Program

## Background

Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO), Canadian Hydrographic Service (CHS) invites proposals for the Arctic Survey Program, a hydrographic survey project that will take place in the Eastern Canadian Arctic.

## Project Description

The project involves chartering a vessel to conduct hydrographic surveys, including:

* The use of a DFO/CHS-supplied and installed multibeam sonar on the charter vessel
* The deployment of a ~6500kg survey launch and ~1500kg uncrewed surface vessel (USV) supplied by DFO/CHS to collect hydrographic data

## Location of Work

The project will take place in the Eastern Canadian Arctic, specifically in the Low Impact Shipping Corridors (LISC) or other prioritized areas identified by CHS.

### Priority Areas

For the 2023 season, the priority area is coastal Baffin Island (see Figure 1). Future dates and locations will be provided if and when option years are exercised.

### Duration of Contract

The contract will be awarded from [date] to December 31, 2023, with options to renew for three additional one-year periods, at the sole discretion of DFO.

### Project Period

Surveys will take place between mid-August and the end of October.

## Procurement Details

* Solicitation Number: 30003895
* Amendments: [Four amendments available for review]
* Tender Closing Date: March 31, 2023, 13:00:00 EST
* Publication Date: February 28, 2023

## Contact Information

Kimberly Walker, Contract Officer
DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
(506) 238-3511

* [Vessel Charter RFPS - English]
* [Solicitation Addendum 4 - Addenda - Bilingual]
* [Addendum 1]
* [Solicitation Addendum 2 - Addenda - Bilingual]
* [Solicitation Addendum 3 - Addenda - Bilingual]
